Country codes

Source: R/country_codes.R
country_codes.Rd

Country codes

Usage

country_codes

Format

Data frame of Gapminder country names and ISO 3166-1 country codes:

country

Country name.

iso_alpha

The 3-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code.

iso_num

The 3-digit ISO 3166-1 numeric-3 code.

Also includes the countries covered by the supplemental data frame gapminder_unfiltered.

Examples

if (require("dplyr")) {
  gapminder %>%
    filter(year == 2007, country %in% c("Kenya", "Peru", "Syria")) %>%
    select(country, continent) %>%
    left_join(country_codes)
}
#> Loading required package: dplyr
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
#> Joining with `by = join_by(country)`
#> # A tibble: 3 × 4
#>   country continent iso_alpha iso_num
#>   <chr>   <fct>     <chr>       <int>

#> 2 Peru    Americas  PER           604
#> 3 Syria   Asia      SYR           760
